title: Female parliamentary representation: SL ranked as 135th country in the world
byline: Though women account for 52 per cent of the total population, Sri Lanka ranks 135 out of 193 countries in the world in terms of female parliamentary representation, according to the World Economic Forum and the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA).

title: US blocks Palestinian leader from attending UN meeting in New York
byline: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas has been blocked from attending the UN General Assembly session in New York next month after he and 80 other Palestinian officials had their visas revoked, the US State Department has confirmed.

title: Ministerial committee on education council holds first meeting
byline: The Ministerial Committee appointed to establish the proposed Education Council convened its first meeting yesterday (29) at the Education Ministry.

title: Trump’s tariffs on Sri Lanka, other countries illegal?
byline: A US appeals court has ruled that most tariffs issued by US President Donald Trump are illegal, setting up a potential legal showdown that could upend his foreign policy agenda.

title: Sri Lanka-UAE direct oil deal: Price negotiations underway
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) is currently engaged in price negotiation with the petroleum authorities of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) to purchase oil under a direct agreement, an official said.

title: Special team to bring back Kehelbaddara Padme, other criminals from Indonesia
byline: A special police team is scheduled to depart for Indonesia to bring back arrested organised criminals, including underworld figure Kehelbaddara Padme, to Sri Lanka.

title: Dry weather likely to ease by early September
byline: The prevailing dry weather conditions across Sri Lanka are likely to change by the first week of September, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Govt. to convert president’s houses, ministers’ bungalows into tourist resorts
byline: The government has invited entrepreneurs to invest in transforming President’s Houses and Ministers’ official bungalows in key tourist locations such as Nuwara Eliya, Anuradhapura, Mahiyanganaya and Kataragama into luxury holiday resorts targeting foreign visitors.

title: Trump’s tariffs on Sri Lanka, other countries illegal?
byline: A US appeals court has ruled that most tariffs issued by US President Donald Trump are illegal, setting up a potential legal showdown that could upend his foreign policy agenda.

title: Mahanayaka Theros call for peace between Thailand, Cambodia
byline: Venerable Omalpe Sobitha Thero submitted a special letter to Minister Vijitha Herath today (30), conveying a united appeal from the four Mahanayaka Theros of Sri Lanka for peace and harmony between Thailand and Cambodia.

title: Western Province plans new dog population management programme
byline: Western Province Governor Hanif Yusoof announced plans to implement a humane and evidence-based dog population management programme across the province.
